entry.title: New release for ProxMenux:
entry.content:
ProxMenux v1.1.2

This is the first official release of the ProxMenux project using GitHub's release system.

While earlier internal versions have been functional, this release marks the beginning of formal version tracking with tags and changelogs.

üì¶ Current project structure

The project is organized into modular, interactive menus designed for managing and customizing a Proxmox VE system:

  1. Post-Install Settings for Proxmox
  2. Help and Info Commands
  3. Hardware: GPU and Coral TPU Tools
  4. Create VMs from Templates or Scripts
  5. Disk and Storage Manager
  6. Essential Proxmox VE Helper Scripts
  7. Network Tools and Tweaks
  8. System Settings and Optimization

The project is based on interactive menus, with multilingual support and a modular architecture.

Thank you for using ProxMenux!
Feel free to report issues or suggest improvements ‚Äî all contributions are welcome üôå

entry.title: New release for ProxMenux:
entry.content:
ProxMenux v1.1.3

This version introduces a major internal update to the way ProxMenux is installed and executed, paving the way for modularity, performance, and user choice.

If you're upgrading from v1.1.2, make sure to read the changes to the installer ‚Äî now you can choose between a full or lightweight version depending on your needs.

üîß Main changes in v1.1.3

üÜï New installer modes

ProxMenux now offers two installation modes:

  1. Lite version (no translations)
  2. Minimal installation
  3. No dependencies beyond dialog and jq

  4. Does not modify your system beyond ProxMenux directory

  5. Full version (with translations)

  6. Runs in a virtual environment
  7. Allows selecting a language interface during installation
  8. Default option for full multilingual support

If you're upgrading and switching from full to lite mode, the previous version will be automatically removed to avoid conflicts.

‚ú® New features

  • Automated Post-Installation Script
    Performs essential setup tasks like APT upgrades, kernel/network tuning, log optimizations, and even Log2RAM if SSD is detected.

  • New Menus

  • System Utilities Installer

  • Network Repair and Configuration Tool

  • New Log2RAM integration
    Automatically configured in the minimal setup when SSD/NVMe is detected.

üõ† Improvements & Fixes

  • Improved logic in post-install and VM creation menus
  • UUP dump script: custom temp directory support + safer cleanup
    (#17, #11)
  • XFS support in disk passthrough for LXC containers ‚Äî thanks @antroxin
  • IOMMU fix for ZFS-based installs (#15)
  • Tool installer rewritten to verify commands after install ‚Äî thanks @DST73 (#18)

üì¶ Project structure

ProxMenux is organized into interactive menus for managing and customizing a Proxmox VE server:

  1. Settings post-install Proxmox
  2. Help and Info Commands
  3. Hardware: GPUs and Coral-TPU
  4. Create VM from template or script
  5. Disk and Storage Manager
  6. Proxmox VE Helper Scripts
  7. Network Management
  8. Utilities and Tools
  9. Settings

Thank you for using ProxMenux!
Please report any bugs or suggestions ‚Äî your feedback helps improve the project for everyone üôå

entry.title: New release for ProxMenux:
entry.content:
ProxMenux v1.1.4

This version focuses on full compatibility with Proxmox VE 9, ensuring that key functionalities like repository setup, remain functional in the new system.

üîß Main changes in v1.1.4

üÜï Proxmox 9 compatibility

  • Repository Setup Updated
    ProxMenux now detects whether the system uses traditional sources.list or the new .sources format introduced in Proxmox 9 ‚Äî and configures the repositories accordingly.

  • Optional Banner Removal for Proxmox 9
    The subscription banner patch is now available for Proxmox 9 if the user chooses to apply it.

‚öôÔ∏è Behavior Improvements

  • Improved Disk Passthrough for LXC
    Now uses persistent UUID paths to ensure correct disk assignment even if device order (/dev/sdX) changes after hardware modifications.

bash PERSISTENT_DISK=$(get_persistent_path "$DISK") if [[ "$PERSISTENT_DISK" != "$DISK" ]] ...

  • More Robust Utility Installer
    Now validates APT sources before trying to install selected tools.
    If none exist (e.g., after fresh install), the default repository entries will be automatically added.

  • Better IOMMU Handling with ZFS
    Detects existing kernel parameters in /etc/kernel/cmdline to avoid duplicating values when enabling IOMMU on ZFS-based systems.

  • Conflict Detection with xshok-proxmox
    Now detects if the xshok-proxmox post-install script was previously executed and alerts the user to avoid potential conflicts.

üßπ Minor Fixes

  • Minor performance optimizations
  • Code cleanup across multiple modules
